Title: GPT‑5 Finally Arrives in Microsoft 365 Copilot

As of August 7, 2025, Microsoft has officially integrated **GPT‑5** into **Microsoft 365 Copilot** across all platforms—web, Windows, Mac, and mobile. The rollout is currently prioritized for licensed users, with broader availability coming soon.

### What’s “Smart Mode”?

- The new **Smart mode** in Copilot dynamically chooses when to use deep reasoning or quick responses based on the nature of your task. No more toggling between modes—the AI figures it out for you.
- For Microsoft 365 Copilot users, activating GPT‑5 is as simple as clicking the new **“Try GPT‑5”** button. Copilot then uses context from your calendar, emails, documents, chats, meeting details, and more to generate responsive, intelligent output.

## Enhanced Functionality & Use Cases

- GPT‑5 brings **advanced reasoning**, **improved contextual understanding**, and **longer conversation memory**, empowering enterprise users to handle complex workflows—from summarizing multi-document threads to synthesizing elaborate email chains.
- The model handles both **web-based and internal work data**, enabling fast yet thoughtful responses throughout your day.
- **Copilot Studio** now allows creators and developers to select GPT‑5 as the primary model for crafting agents. These agents can manage sophisticated business processes using real-time model routing for optimal performance.

## Broader Integration Across Microsoft’s AI Ecosystem

- Beyond Microsoft 365 Copilot, GPT‑5 is now embedded across the entire **Copilot ecosystem**—including GitHub Copilot, Azure AI Foundry, and the standalone Copilot app.
- Developers get early access through **Azure AI Foundry**, with model routing that selects the best GPT‑5 variant for different tasks.
- **GitHub Copilot** users on paid plans can now choose GPT‑5 in VS Code, GitHub Chat, and GitHub Mobile. Organizations must enable the new GPT‑5 policy in their admin settings.

## What This Means for Users & Enterprises

- For **enterprise users**: Expect smarter, faster, and more contextually aware productivity. From email triage to document drafting, GPT‑5 helps you manage complex tasks with ease.
- For **developers**: GPT‑5’s improvements in code quality and reasoning mean fewer bugs, better pull requests, and a stronger foundation for building intelligent agent-based systems.

GPT‑5’s integration into Microsoft 365 Copilot is a transformative leap—offering a unified, intelligent assistant that adapts to your needs, handles deeper reasoning, and streamlines productivity across your work tools. It’s not just an upgrade—it’s a smarter way to work.
